 Regarding: Is "X" a life?
 "A life", and "living", have two different connotations.
 "Living" applies to our tissues, our cells, anything we ARBITRARILY define as "life". in short, anything comprised of living cells, is "living".
 
 Now, is it "a life"? Define "a life". If you define "a life". The debate often seems to take the form of logical fallacy, and it doesn't need to. You can have an abortion debate from BOTH sides, without being illogical, I don't know why that's so hard.
